website_summaries.verdict: This brace stands out for the contoured design and comfort. Left or right specificity helps it to fit better than most braces.
pros: Metal support plate immobilizes where it's needed
Interior fabric strip prevents Velcro from rubbing against the skin
Breathable padding and fabric make it comfortable all night
cons: The largest available size may not work for those with large, wide hands

website_summaries.verdict: Whether you’re recovering from an injury or need relief from chronic pain, this eco-friendly wrist brace offers an unbeatable combination of comfort, support, and durability.
pros: Contoured rigid top and bottom stays effectively stabilize the wrist, while still allowing fingers to move freely
Extra cushioning prevents digging and irritation
Lightweight design and breathable materials remain comfortable even with extended use
cons: Some feel that the thumb support is a bit too restrictive

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient to put on due to short straps and slots
customer_reviews.text: Having carpal tunnel and arthritis, I wanted wrist supports that would be more comfortable for work and sleeping than the Futuro wrist supports I have been using. The immediate problem I recognized with the Mueller Fitted Wrist Braces is the need to thread the velcro straps through the slots when putting them on - very difficult and painful with swollen, stiff finger joints. This problem could have been alleviated with longer velcro straps, allowing the supports to be slipped on without the tedium of dealing with the straps and slots. I ordered the proper Sm/M size (the L/XL would have been far too big), so exchanging for a larger size would not be an option. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Graymalkin

customer_reviews.title: Beware the listed sizing. Product is un-returnable.
customer_reviews.text: Be warned that while Size Medium is listed as 5-8" wrist circumference, I would not suggest buying a medium unless your wrist is 6.5" or smaller around. I measured at 7.5" and the Medium size brace is both way too tight and the adjustment straps are at the VERY edge of their length. So, consider that 8" as "the product will be unusable for you" rather than "this is the largest circumference that is still reasonably functional". Thankfully since I can't return them, I now have wrist braces I get to donate to Goodwill. My fault, I suppose, for buying something like this from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eddy

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro stopped holding after only 3 months. Get the Wellgate brace, it lasts years. I've had 3 of those and only replaced them because they started looking dingy. Should have stuck with what I knew!
customer_reviews.author: kckevinwhite

customer_reviews.title: The opening for the thumb is cut very low, not as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: This wrist support advertised as being useful for scapho--lunate instability but it is just a carpal tunnel brace in my opinion, a completely different issue. The opening for the thumb is very large and cut very low on the small which I received. The support pictured in the ad did not show this so that the item is not useful to me. The Packing Slip states that "hygiene" items are not returnable but this support is worn over dry intact skin in open view of the public; it is no more than a supportive half-glove. Since a glove is certainly not a hygiene item and is returnable so should this be.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, not good for small hands.
customer_reviews.text: Nice brace, but not for small hands...unable to stabilize my hand so defeats the purpose for me. My pain is on the top of my hand towards base of wrist. The wrist closure is good for my wrists which measure 6” diameter. The Velcro has plenty of space to catch on the fuzzy part, others I’ve tried do not. I’d recommend this brace for someone with palms that measure about 8”...mine is barely 7 1/2. See my photos.
customer_reviews.author: jannymarie

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight - great fit
customer_reviews.text: I have worn heavy, long wrist braces for years. I was thrilled when I found the Mueller Green fitted wrist brace. I have carpel tunnel and have had to wear the braces when I sleep to keep my hands from going numb. I am happy to say the Mueller Green Fitted Wrist Braces are light weight, fit nicely and don't have long cumbersome strips of velcro like previous braces I've worn (which BTW have picked my bed sheets terribly). I like these new light weight braces soooo much I ordered another pair. I don't want to be without them and I hope Mueller is listening and will not discontinue this product in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Bonyea

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using any type of device for my carpal tunnel and so far I have felt great relief. I spend 10- 12 hours a day typing at my computer for work and my wrist was killing me. So I decided to look for something that might help alleviate the pain. I was pretty skeptical at first. As there are so many to chose from all with varying prices and they all do the same thing. I wasn't really convinced it would help, but desperate enough to give it a try. From the moment I put this thing on I could feel instant relief. It's well made, comfortable and does exactly as it says! Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: I loved it at first
customer_reviews.text: Initially it was the most comfortable wrist brace I've ever used. I wore it 24/7, even at night. Suddenly after about 2 months of constant use, the thumb hole began to dig into the web of my hand between my thumb and forefinger. I had to throw it away it was so painful to wear. I was disappointed. I don't know what changed about the brace. Maybe wearing is constantly eventually made my that sensitive part of my hand extremely vulnerable to fairly sturdy fabric rubbing on it over time. If you only need it for typing, I think it would be fine. I do not recommend wearing it all day and/or all night. I give it a 4.
customer_reviews.author: milo101

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Range of motion is excellent- considering it provides NO support and I can still fully bend my wrists with it on. The hard part is up by the thumb, above the wrist, so I'm not sure how the makers think this would work for the wrist. I have severe carpal tunnel on both sides. Shooting burning tingling pain from my elbows to finger tips. Based on reviews i thought this would give me some relief and I ordered the right and left. Once again, no relief, just wasted more money. Still waking up 5 times a night in pain.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Thumb hole is too small
customer_reviews.text: I purchased both the left and right hand brace to be worn during the night. The brace did great job securing my wrists, however after wearing them for about four hours I felt discomfort in the flesh between my thumbs and index fingers on both hands. I woke up often during the night from the pain it was causing, tried to stretch the thumb hole so it won't dig into my flesh, which did not help. By morning the pain from the brace digging into my thumbs was worse and had caused a rash in both hands. After one night use both braces were returned to Amazon. I have since purchased the ComfyBrace, which has been very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Neroos

customer_reviews.title: Helped to reduce pain in my wrist while sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I wear this at night to help with the numbness and tingling feeling I’ve been having for the past few months when I go to sleep, the pain had been very uncomfortable and interfering with my sleep. Since I’ve been wearing these ( I bought one for each wrist) I’ve been sleeping through the night. It’s easy to adjust to your comfort and comfortable enough to wear while sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Shamonique

customer_reviews.title: Carpel tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Was suppose to have surgery but was postponed because of the virus. This works great! Can still do what i need to do, has great range and mobility without my wrist bending completely, which would cause alot of pain if i bent to much. Fingers can still move normal and doesn't irritate skin. I was it every evening and hang to dry...its dry by morning as long as i dont get it soaked.
customer_reviews.author: lilboss3

customer_reviews.title: Well-made brace, not a good option for smaller wrists/hands.
customer_reviews.text: I measured out my wrist to about 6.25", so I was hoping for a good fit. However, the brace seems to be made more with the upper size range in mind as it does not secure comfortably for smaller wrists/hands. In particular, the strap closest to my palm needs to be stuck to the brace itself, not the velcro strip, for a decent fit. If one stays within the designed velcro areas, the fit is too loose and wearing the brace becomes pointless. The brace does have its pros, though. It is well-made and, when secured to fit properly, does provide good support.
customer_reviews.author: N. Martínez

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're S or L but not medium
customer_reviews.text: Great if you're S or L but not medium. I tired the small one and it seems too small because the skin between between thumb and index finger it pulls down on it. The L and XL size is way too big and the strap wouldn't hold my hand. If you're in the size of small or large. It works very well at keeping your wrist. The material doesn't seem like it would last a very long time. And it doesn't seem like this would wash well. If you're like me and not all use a medium glove. You'll need to find something that offer a medium only size.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hu

customer_reviews.title: Mueller Green Fitted Wrist Brace
customer_reviews.text: I am SO PLEASED with this product! I recently developed carpal tunnel syndrome in my right wrist/ hand, and for not being certain about what brand or type of brace to buy, I was pleasantly surprised with this purchase and very pleased! It's a VERY WELL MADE, sturdy fabric and fits very comfortably with it's adjustable fasteners. The reinforced plate inside running from the palm to the bottom end has excellent stability and keeps my wrist from bending forward where it's painful. I would definitely recommend this item to anyone with pain in their wrist for whatever the cause. Very happy, thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: TLC

customer_reviews.title: Size runs too small
customer_reviews.text: I measured my wrist and bought the size the manufacturer claimed I needed and it was too small. Even though (per the instructions) it should have fit my wrist comfortably, it was very small and I could hardly get it on. Therefore, I did not find this brace useful and did not wear it long term. The quality of the brace itself seems fine, but I would order a size bigger than claimed by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not too bulky, perfect for work
customer_reviews.text: I have another brace that works well, but I bought this one because it looked much less bulky and I’m so glad I did. It fits without being too tight, and i can actually use it for computer work during the day. Material is sturdy, and I like that supports my wrist really well. I’ve used it for several hours at work and haven’t yet had an issue with sweaty palms either, so that’s a plus. It’s important to choose the right size for your hand. I always make sure the brace is just snug but not tight enough to restrict circulation.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Runs Small
customer_reviews.text: First let me say these run small. My wrist is 7", I ordered the medium which says 5-8"...I can just barely hook the velcro straps, and they tend to come out of the holes as I put it on. Once on it IS comfortable so no issue there. It does help my carpal tunnel pain. I didn't return for the x-large (no offer available for just large) and was afraid it would be t big and not offer the support I need. I can move and use my fingers while wearing this brace and it does protect my wrist from the repetitive movement that causes the pain flare ups. So size it up if you want this item.
customer_reviews.author: Moonminx

customer_reviews.title: Helped my Synovitis was Comfortable and Fit Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have some synovitis in my wrist and it was hurting to the point that if my baby kicked my hand the wrong way I would yell in pain! This brace helped me immensely as I still had to carry my baby throughout the day and do other things. The brace didn’t heal my synovitis, but it allowed me to keep using my wrist. I massaged the crap out of my wrist in between use on the parts that hurt and after a couple weeks my wrist is doing much better and I only need the brace sometimes. Also I am very petite, 4’11” and 96lbs and this brace fit me very well.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: After 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this 2 years ago for carpal tunnel. I just looked up my old order to see if I could wash in the machine. Hand wash - line dry, which is what I've been doing. These fit me perfectly. 7" wrists and fairly big hands and I ordered sm/md. No irritation and still holding up great. Fits perfectly (the velcro strap could be a little bit longer). I wear both at night and a lot during the day in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Walker

customer_reviews.title: Does its job, and does it well
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it should, gives support to my wrist, looks exactly as it is pictured on the site, is easy to adjust, and is comfy! My *ONLY* gripe (and it's a cosmetic thing, a bit petty maybe) is that it is black - I think I'd prefer it a bit better if it came in a more 'neutral' color so that it doesn't stand out as much (on my pale, porcelain arm, lol), which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. However, that aside: it works great and doesn't cost an arm and a leg, so if you need a simple wrist brace, I definitely recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: Katie VendettiTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with protection on both the top and bottom
customer_reviews.text: I had another brand of brace that had protection in the form of a metal bar on the top of the wrist and it was so painful I had to remove the bar. I was wary of trying another brace with the top piece, especially as this one cannot be removed, but it has proved to be extremely comfortable! This brace provides more stability than my futuro one as well, and they have intelligently designed the velcro to end on the side of the wrist so normal work doesn't weaken the straps over time. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: trixs

customer_reviews.title: Works well, a little pokey
customer_reviews.text: Wearing this at night immediately helped with the fatigue I was starting to feel in my arm. It's pretty comfortable, other than that the lining between my skin and the velcro doesn't seem to come down all the way anymore. I don't think about it until I'm putting it on in the dark so I don't know how easy it is to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Angi H

customer_reviews.title: Very good support
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6.5" wrist. I bought the S/M. It fits well, with a small gap towards the bottom of the brace. If your wrist is larger than that I would go up in the size. The shaft below the thumb is about 3.5" long. The thumb opening takes some getting used to as it does rub on the palm area. I have found that to be true on all braces. The support across the palm and wrist seems to be a hard plastic or very thin metal. There is additional support across the back of the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bama

customer_reviews.title: Saving money on medical bills.
customer_reviews.text: Like any wrist brace, this prevents painful movement and it certainly protects me from carpal tunnel and it will fix my sprained wrist (with ice as well). If you are worried about a sprained wrist, don't bother with ridiculously expensive medical bills (they will charge you for letting you wear their wrist brace, then 10 times as much to keep it). It causes chaffing on the skin between the thumb and pointer, but this is common with any wrist brace. I like it, it's cheap, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Too small for small wrists
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brace for support with my right wrist since I have major discomfort from carpal tunnel. I’m know for having small wrists, but the small/medium size is incredibly uncomfortable and way too small for me. It cuts off my circulation and makes my wrists and hands hurt even worse. I will be returning product.
customer_reviews.author: Erin N.

customer_reviews.title: It just works!
customer_reviews.text: I've had carpal tunnel in my right hand for years due to extended computer use. As more of my work has been shifted online, I've found it incredibly painful to even use my mouse. I was recommended this brace a few days ago and the results were immediate. My pain, stiffness, and soreness were gone after one day. I've worked long hours at my desk with it on and it holds my wrist in a very comfortable and secure position, with virtually zero pain afterwards. I don't even notice I'm wearing it after a little while, so sleeping with it on is incredibly convenient. I'm highly satisfied and recommending it to everyone with wrist pain!
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Works for wife
customer_reviews.text: My wife wears a woman's small glove. Bought the small for each hand and she is happy with fit. She was having increasing problems with what seems to be carpal tunnel issues, and might times a real problem. Pain and numbness keeping her from sleeping, she'd have to hang over side of bed worth hands dangling to get to subside. She started wearing these as soon as she went to bed but after a few days stopped because she found the experience too confining, even though they helped with symptoms. Now she puts them on only when she needs them during the night, they are that easy to put on. She says they are helping a lot.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Good option for a low price
customer_reviews.text: Good option for a low price. I work on the computer, and started getting pain and tingling in my right hand a few weeks ago. I've been wearing this at work for two weeks, and the discomfort has almost completely gone away. I ended up getting a left brace too, to prevent that hand from getting that bad. It's not easy to type with them on, but you get used to it. There is one very itchy seam on the top inside, so I got some stockinette sleeves, which will hopefully also keep the brace clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time to get used to, but it's fantastic. I have been using two of these, one for each hand, as needed for almost a year, and i'm so pleased. My hands sweat a lot, and I was super concerned. My hands still sweat with these, but not more than without any hand coverings. They're comfortable, sturdy, and adjustable in exactly the right way. I'm very happy with mine c:
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Developed carpal tunnel during my 3rd pregnancy and it has no gone away 1 year later. My hand would go numb each night - causing a difficult night sleep. This has made sleeping so much better. I only wear at night. I got a sm/med and maybe should have purchased a large/xl size, but the sm/med is ok. This has made my carpal tunnel so much better at night and I have regained some strength in my hand during the day. I used to drop random items during the day. So happy I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie3

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to help keep my wrist from moving. I have severe RA and if I move my wrist too much it swells and gets oh so painful. So this is great for nighttime and anytime I feel I may over exert my wrist. I tend to wear it a lot and it feels "Safe". The Velcro straps are in a perfect spot as to not bother me with anything I do, and since its hand washable, I wash it when I need and it dries very quickly. No complaints here at all, but I will be ordering another just in case I need it and they discontinue this one,,,
customer_reviews.author: KarenWasHere

customer_reviews.title: Great Wrist Support!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product (plus one for my left wrist) before the cold season set in as my wrists and hands tend to hurt as the temperatures dip. Thank you, chronic auto-immune disease. -_- Anyway, my left wrist started to hurt a lot on Sunday so I've been wearing the brace to keep it sturdy while I worked. Coupled with my pain rub, it really did the trick. It also helped me to hold heavier objects with my left hand without putting pressure on it. I'm not looking forward to when my right wrist decides to join the pain party, but at least I know I made a great decision to buy this brace.
customer_reviews.author: Peta of LLS

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I was dealing with a pain in, like, a bone at the base of the hand/lower wrist area of my right hand that aligned roughly with the pinkie. Weeks and weeks of treatment with heat/ice/topical pain relievers/NSAIDs did not relieve it. I decided to give this a shot, and it worked great. I'm a writer, so it was important that it not be a hindrance to typing. If was firm and snug, but did not overly interfere with movement and was not uncomfortable. I'd definitely recommend this brace.
customer_reviews.author: Spalding W. Coyote

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! Used for carpel tunnel syndrome
customer_reviews.text: Used this because I started getting carpal tunnel syndrome in my right hand and used this brace non-stop for about 2 weeks straight and REALLY helped bring back more motion to my hand. It kept in place and hasnt fallen apart, despite my constant velcro adjustments. Only thing I'd say as a con is if you put it too tight it gets uncomfortable between your index and thumb area but other than that I'm pretty much healed!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Reduces pain associated with mild carpel tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Im definitely glad that I have this wrist brace, as there have been many times that it has helped reduce or sometimes completely eliminate my wrist/hand pain. It helps by keeping my wrist and hand aligned and inhibits the free movement that contributes to the pain. I don’t feel comfortable driving with the brace on since I am right-handed and the brace covers part of my palm, which is a bummer after a long day of work when my carpel tunnel is especially bad.
customer_reviews.author: mars

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: It deffinately helps with the pain in my wrist and keeping it stable BUT the part that wraps around the thumb defifnately cuts into the space between the thumb and forefinger.. I have to wear bandaids to prevent rubbing and irritation.. Other than that, a great product!
customer_reviews.author: CPRicva

customer_reviews.title: Not small enough for average female hands
customer_reviews.text: This brace would be perfect if it came in a small enough size, because it's quite comfortable. The small/medium size is made for larger women's or smaller men's hands. My wrist is a hair over 6 in around, and when I cinch this brace tightly enough for me, the velcro tabs overhang too far and snag up my clothes. And even then, there's still too much play in my hand. I had to get the DonJoy Bionic brace, and I keep the Mueller as a backup at work, in case I forget the one that fits.
customer_reviews.author: that's-not-my-name

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small wrists
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the most comfortable wrist brace I've ever worn. I'm so picky with braces because I have tiny wrists and I usually have to pull tighter than I should just to get it to fit. This one fits perfect, and it's so comfortable. It's cushiony and firm at the same time. I love the bright green color on the inside. My only complaint is the same as the other reviews, how the bit of fabric where the thumb is is just awkward. Besides that, perfect!
customer_reviews.author: saml

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wrist guard!
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed pain in my wrist while typing on the computer. Being a writer, I spend a lot of time on my laptop and needed something to prevent me from continuing to put stress on my wrist. This guard has made using the computer much more comfortable, and I'm far less worried about developing carpal tunnel syndrome. I ordered size small/medium and it fits well on my little wrists without being too tight or oversized. I've recommended this wrist guard to others who've had the same experience and they've also noticed a difference. Would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Llewyn Davis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect brace
customer_reviews.text: Got this to support my wrist after my orthopedic doctor suggested me to get one for my Carpal Tunnel. They were selling them but it was expensive and I couldn’t return them in case of problem. So I purchased this. They are very comfortable and fit very well. I like that there is a breathable fabric lining that gives good protection from any irritation. I would positively consider purchasing any other products from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: sheedeals

customer_reviews.title: Best brace for ease of use and stability - perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was looking for a brace I could wear while typing at work to minimize discomfort from carpal tunnel. I have a few others but didn’t provide enough support while allowing enough mobility to type and use a mouse. This brace works perfectly. I can make it snug enough to feel stable without cutting off circulation, unlike previous braces I used. Bonus: i can put it on and take it off quickly, super handy when one uses the bathroom/washes their hands frequently. Wish I’d found this brace before spending money on ones that didn’t even come close.
customer_reviews.author: Heazo

customer_reviews.title: Resolved Wrist Pain Immediately
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I was skeptical of a brace helping me - the bone in my wrist opposite the thumb was killing me for days! I couldn't even sit up in bed - I am only 23! The brace took all the strain off of the wrist. You can't move it into a position that hurts without really trying.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Mock

customer_reviews.title: Best Brace Ever for Carpal Tunnel Relief!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable, effective wrist brace I’ve ever used! The palm support makes it far superior to others, especially for relief of carpal tunnel symptoms. Highly recommended! I gave three stars for range of motion only because brace is designed to restrict some motion, which it does. However, it still allows thumb to operate freely.
customer_reviews.author: redhed

customer_reviews.title: Irritation, improper finish, itching, cannot wear
customer_reviews.text: Seam at bottom of "V" inbetween thumb and index finger causes irritation Woken up 1st night with severe itching at that location, both hands. Found a "burr" where seam had not been finished properly. Straps too short, have to be threaded every time you put these on. Not comfortable, cannot wear. Have no clue where the positive reviews come from. Maybe these are knock offs or perhaps there was a change in manufacturing location/plants. NFG for me.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Functioned well, even while wearing medical (nitrile) gloves over it!
customer_reviews.text: I wore this brace when I had some tendonitis in my right wrist. All I can say is the tendonitis didn't last long after wearing this brace, so it must have done something right! I wore the wrist brace while doing my floor nursing duties for two consecutive days, and was able to apply large rubber (nitrile) gloves over it for patient care. I was able to move my hand and fingers around fine, while avoid to much flexion of my wrist. I was able to use a computer keyboard & mouse, but became mindful that that was a source of the original pain. No skin irritation or abrasion (wore during activity for 2 days).
customer_reviews.author: Cocoa Brown

customer_reviews.title: Wife has an allergic reaction.
customer_reviews.text: Wife complained about rash on her wrist using this product. Apparently she is allergic to the foam padding. I ordered one for her left had of a different brand. Will wait and see how that one works out. She is using an elastic bandage at the present time. The bandage is OK as far as it goes, but doesn't provide enough support.
customer_reviews.author: Beorge

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this wrist brace.
customer_reviews.text: Went to a Orthopedic doctor for sudden and painful discomfort in my right hand near the ball joint. Turns out I had a Ganglion Cyst which is a very minor injury but nonetheless I wanted to get it checked out. They recommended Aleve, as well as a wrist brace to limit movement to give it time to rest since I work at an office job. They said I could buy their wrist brace for $70, or pickup one from Amazon for around $15 which was a no-brainer. This wrist brace was absolutely perfect and highly recommended. After taking Aleve and using the brace, I was in good health in 2-3 days!
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with a wrist that may or may not be carpel tunnel but the doctor recommended I try this first. When I first started wearing it at night it hurt, but it was doing what it is supposed to (stretching the ligaments back out). After wearing it for a few nights my wrist started feeling better. I do not wear it every night but now only have to wear it when my wrist starts hurting again. I highly recommend trying this if you have carpel tunnel or similar symptoms... it worked for me anyway
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Helps with numbing/pain caused by cell phone use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this when I started experiencing numbing and pain in my hand and fingers from excessive cell phone use. I wore it for about a week and stopped wearing it after the numbing subsided. It primarily helps remind me to be more cognizant of the angle I am using my hand. My husband recently had similar hand/wrist pain and decided to wear it. It has helped him as well.
customer_reviews.author: mkysayTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: This is a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I dot usually review things but this is a lifesaver. I'd been having one an of carpal tunnel pain for about a month and a few days before buying it was almost constant. Anti-inflammatories helped but the pain came back quick. After putting this thing one the pain was much more tolerable almost immediately. After about a week of wearing it (and still taking regular Anti-inflammatories of course) I feel almost no pain.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Helps me sleep
customer_reviews.text: I love these wrist guards. I bought one for both hands and they have helped me to sleep through the night without waking up in pain. I used to wake up several times a night with my hands and arms numb and at times it could be really painful. Thanks to these braces that is no longer an issue. Even if I wake up and my hand is slightly numb it is never bad and it goes away fairly easily. My only concern is the how long the Velcro will last. Hopefully it will last a year or more because I use these nightly.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael's_treasures

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: They’re not super comfortable, but no wrists braces are comfortable. These are *more* comfortable than others I have tried. They don’t seem to get overly warm which is nice. They wash easily and are also easy to put on and take off. I’m able to sleep with them on. I’ve been wearing them nightly for about 3 months and while I haven’t seen an amazing improvement in my carpal tunnel symptoms, there has been some improvement and that’s made these worth their price.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: No good at all for moderate ulnar neuropathy from typing
customer_reviews.text: I get pain, aches, numbness, and tingling from my pinkies to my elbows. I am a programmer for a living. My problem seems to mostly be caused by and aggravated by hitting the modifier keys (SHIFT, CTRL, and ALT) on the keyboard many times in a day. I wear braces on both wrists all day and night. These braces did nothing for me. They are not rigid. It doesn't feel like there is any metal in there. If there is, it's crappy, thin aluminum. They were not capable of tightening enough for my very small wrists. The inside fabric made me very itchy.
customer_reviews.author: zamnedix

customer_reviews.title: excellent brace for TFCC tear
customer_reviews.text: This brace has been a life saver. I have a tfcc tear and my wrist is extremely painful. It's been a couple of months now. I probably need surgery on it but I don't have any time off of work to pursue this. Anyway this brace makes it possible to get through the day and night without moving my wrist in a bad way and causing excruciating pain non-stop for a week. it's better than the several other ones that I have tried. I'm very pleased with it even though I wish I didn't need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Very snug
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16.5" wrist so I got the medium...which actually says Small/Medium on the packaging. It fits my wrist nicely, but I have large hands and the part you put your thumb through digs in to the area between my thumb and first finger. However, other than that it is VERY comfortable. The brace this replaced didn't have the soft liner inside so the velcro straps dug in to my skin. The inner liner fixes that problem. I also like that it is not flashy with printing and designs all over it like other braces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ivey

customer_reviews.title: support for wrist sprain
customer_reviews.text: I sprained my wrist and this was good for providing some stability in holding my wrist joint “together” so I could perform basic activities without too much pain such as cooking (cutting with a knife, lifting a pan), opening doors , or anything that involved rotational movement. Later in the healing process this was good for support such as when attempting racket sports.
customer_reviews.author: a.hsu

customer_reviews.title: SIZING CHART IS NOT CORRECT!
customer_reviews.text: I measured my wrist and it is 7". So I ordered the SM/Med size as it would cover 5.0 to 8.0 inches. I could barely get my hand in the wrap and the Velcro straps were difficult to latch because it was so small. As others have mentioned, the thumb hole is too small and therefore it pulls. I like the quality of the product and I'm sure it would do the job were it not so small.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: 80% good, $20% bad
customer_reviews.text: I have carpal tunnel, and these wrist braces really help a lot! They're easy to put on, nicely padded, and easy to adjust. The one thing that made me take away a star, is the fact that the folds are very very uncomfortable for long term use because the creases start molding into your skin. Also, doesnt breathe SUPER well, but good enough for what i paid! Keep in mind, this issue may not apply to everyone. I do heavy lifting, and small + large pet care full-time. So i get hotter and i tend to need to wear it longer. Other than all that, its awesome. Dont regret my purchase one bit!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Skovey

customer_reviews.title: very happy with product
customer_reviews.text: so i brought two different ones at the same time. and while i like both i like this one better. it is not as bulky and given i have smaller hands and arms i appreciated the reduction in bulk. it seems better built then others i have tried and less concerned about Velcro ruining it later. i wear them every night and seems like these should last longer then my others.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted and needed
customer_reviews.text: I started experiencing carpal tunnel symptoms within the last month. I wanted to try out a brace before going through more extreme methods and this brace has helped significantly. I wear it on a full time schedule right now and I even sleep in it. It's not uncomfortable. The adjustable straps are a plus and the fit was great. I ordered a second one so that I can have one that I use for in the house only. My symptoms are alleviating and I have this brace to thank for that.
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: instant relief
customer_reviews.text: I've got beginning symptoms of carpal tunnel and this splint instantly provided relief to the pain on my wrist. I am a college student so I was worried about how easily I'd be able to write. To be honest, it was not as difficult as I'd imagined it would be to do while wearing a wrist brace. It's definitely not as easy as writing without one, but it's not impossible. Another thing to note is that when it's fresh out of the package and a couple days after, it has a weird smell as new things smell. It gave me a headache but I think that depends on the sensitivity of a person.
customer_reviews.author: Emely Tacuri

customer_reviews.title: BRACE THAT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality product. I had no clue what to expect as this is my first time addressing the symptoms associated with carpal tunnel. I've been wearing these (both hands) at work while I keyboard and at night when I sleep. THEY WORK. All I know is that typically I cannot feel my hands, have numbness in my arms, hands & fingers. When I wear these to bed at night I am not waking up with he numbness & tingling in my arms & hands. During the day, wearing these, they have alleviated the 'falling asleep' sensations in my hands while I keyboard, etc.
customer_reviews.author: syvchick

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: This was better than I expected and it does its' job. I bought this due to wrist pain I was having, likely stemming from Radial nerve pain on my forearm and my wrist. In addition to housework and cooking, I also use my computer a lot for work. As constant use of my hands aggregates my wrist, this helps to minimize the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine T

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a small wrist (6" around) and had nerve symptoms which would wake me up at night with pain or strong nerve sensations. I ordered a Small. It fit my wrist with enough room in the sleeve so that the tabs did not pull out of the slots when I put it on, making it easy to put on. My nerve symptoms subsided quickly, and the brace is very comfortable. The lining is soft and cushioned. This brace is delaying if not eliminating my need to have carpal tunnel surgery.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, reduces pain!
customer_reviews.text: Recently I've had more and more issues with my carpal tunnel, especially in the palm of my hand. This brace fits comfortably, has a ton of stability and works as good as I'd imagine it could. This is the first brace I've owned and I do not see any reason why I would want to change to a different option. Helps reduce the pain and is comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: SeattlePrincess

customer_reviews.title: Better than Rx wrist splints.
customer_reviews.text: Best wrist splints I have ever had. I have a larger forearm but small hands for a woman. The Rx ones the doctor ordered To fit my forearm they were way too big on my hand. These in the size large extra large were perfect I wear an 8 inch bracelet ladies. Easy to sleep in and do most chores just takeoff and not get wet. Have definitely helped a wrist sprain do you hold it stable!
customer_reviews.author: Jules66

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Thumb Hole
customer_reviews.text: In my search for something to help with an ache in my wrist, I came upon this brace and decided to try it out. So far I like everything about it except the small hole for my thumb. The brace feels good and my wrist feels better after wearing it, but the webbing between my thumb and pointer finger is often sore or red after use. I have tried wearing the brace loose and tight, but the issue persists. I'm tempted to take scissors to it to enlarge the hole, but the material is reinforced and I worry it may gray if cut. :/
customer_reviews.author: D$

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrist support for my carpal pain
customer_reviews.text: I really like this wrist brace. It allows enough range of motion to perform everyday tasks but provides enough support to help with a sore wrist. I finally wore out the fabric covering the plastic support piece so I bought another one. Oh, the hook and eye material wore out on one of the straps as well. Even so, this brace will be hard to beat. Toss it in the washer with your color load, let it air dry and it's good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for small hands, needs more support in the thumb part
customer_reviews.text: This worked ok, I was having minor pain in my wrist/hand where the thumb is. It definitely kept my hand in a stable position. I think there could be some added stability in the thumb part as that is where my pain is. So if you have similar pain, I would search for one that has thumb stability and support. Also, my hands and wrists are small and I needed this to be a bit smaller even though I ordered the smaller size. I had to crisscross the straps in order to make it tighter.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: A bit small
customer_reviews.text: I feel like spent some time reading comments and reviews to try to get the right size for my wrist, and ordered a small, and it is a bit too small. Not enough to be a bother, but also it doesn't quite make my wrist as stable as I'd like. This being a budget option, I can accept that. It is a good value, even if I would have bought a bigger size if I could try them on in person.
customer_reviews.author: H. H.

customer_reviews.title: Seems well made so far.
customer_reviews.text: My wrist had been hurting, so I thought getting a wrist brace to restrict movement would help w/the pain. It didn't totally restrict my movements so I still felt discomfort, but the brace feels well made otherwise. I have very, very tiny wrists and it fit snugly enough (but did have a teeny bit of wiggle room, which I didn't really want). Sometimes the velcro would come off if it caught on something else, but nothing too annoying. I think it would fit most people, I just have baby wrists and need something a tad bit more restricting.
customer_reviews.author: KWalker17

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Although it supports the wrist, I am disappointed that the insert to support the palm of the hand is not formed well and is uncomfortable. I purchased another brand that is much more comfortable. Perhaps it will fit some people better than others. Just feels like a defect to me.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to have symptoms of carpal tunnel. I work an office job where I'm at the computer 9 hours a day, typing or using a mouse. I purchased the Mueller Fitted Wrist Brace and immediately noticed an improvement in the throbbing pain in my wrist area. It's slim and it is comfortable. The only problem I've had is that it makes me sweat like crazy. It's very hot and I'm afraid it'll get smelly and dirty quickly. Luckily, the black fabric hides dirt, sweat and grime.
customer_reviews.author: DakOdinTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, small, but SMELLS
customer_reviews.text: I have some sensory issues. The brace doesn't completely avoid them (you can feel the stitching on the inside) but it was easy to adjust to. Sometimes I had to make sure the brace was in exactly the right position, but, again, easy to adjust to. I think I'm going to stop wearing it now though, because it smells terrible after just one day of wear now. I used to be able to get away with only washing it weekly. I can't wash it every single night. It doesn't work that way. So no more brace for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Green band inside
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing this - the first one last a few years. But unlike the first one this has a green band connecting the two sides whereas the last one had black - this is a dealbreaker for me as I wear it to work wearing my suits and the green cloth makes it look comical....I would have returned it but my kid already trashed the cover it came in !! PS. Looking back I realize it says green but the pictures and the video on amazon do a darn good job of hiding the green band.
customer_reviews.author: sherlock

customer_reviews.title: This is my 2nd Mueller wrist brace and I love it. My first is many years old and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Mueller wrist brace and I love it. My first is many years old and the velcro has not kept it together for years now. Had resorted to rubber bands which works fairly well but they stretch and have that rubber smell. I believe these are hand washable but mine gets very sweaty here in Fla so I do throw it in the washer then let it air dry. Have had no problems with this. When this one gets old and ratty I will throw it in the dryer too but that should not be for quite some time yet. I'm hoping these will still be available for any future needs.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Tuckman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and helpful
customer_reviews.text: I'm a groomer and have been showing signs for developing carpal tunnel recently. My hand and wrist are in a lot of pain at the end of each day, my fingers will lock up sometimes while grooming and my wrist will feel so weak that I almost drop things while holding them and can't put much pressure on it. This brace has helped a lot by giving my hand and wrist support and holding everything in place. I wear it when I'm not working and I can feel the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Mills

customer_reviews.title: Becomes uncomfortable after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good brace. Should be 5 star in all categories. The reason it is not is that the fabric in the interior part of the brace (the part that touches skin) becomes jagged and feels like sandpaper after more than a few weeks of use. Carpal tunnel makes one's sensitivity to touch greater, and having the abrasive feeling from the Mueller brace is very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Korm

customer_reviews.title: Feels very protective & yet comfortable
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Have a broken wrist, & the hard removable splint from the doctor causes me to wake up with pain in my forearm! SO, I ordered this fabric splint, and after trying it on, I'm so excited to see how it is to sleep in! No problems wiih thumbhole like other reviews have claimed! They must have huge thumbs, because I'm still swollen since surgery, & it fits me perfect! Very well made!!
customer_reviews.author: Deana

customer_reviews.title: Eased the pain and helped heal carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Great brace! I’ve purchased pricier brands in the past and this surpasses those. You won’t be disappointed. After the Covid-19 outbreak I began using my laptop w/o wrist pads, began cleaning/moving and organizing like crazy for 2 weeks, resulting in severe carpal tunnel syndrome in both hands. Numbness, tingling, pins & needles during the night and chronic pain during the day. Bought 2 of these and they’ve really helped. Especially when sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Just Right
customer_reviews.text: Have been using wrist braces for over 30 years for carpel tunnel and every time I find one I like, by the time I've worn it out, it is no longer available to replace. Have every style and kind and the Mueller is just right. Not too much, not too little, just right. Easy to put on, comfortable to wear at night and day.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Good Brace With Excellent Support - Sizing Runs Small and Causes Frustration
customer_reviews.text: Gave good support, sizing runs small. I have medium sized hands, and as a woman I purchased the small/medium size (the next size up is large and x-large). The small-medium size needs longer straps to keep them within the guides when you're putting them on. The straps slip out of the slots when you're putting them on and when you have the brace on, it's difficult to feed them back through. The green cloth under the straps is too small to do its job and needs to be larger. I bought both left and right hand braces and the brace itself gives excellent support, but the sizing is frustrating because of the difficulty stated above.
customer_reviews.author: SReid

customer_reviews.title: good blend of mobility and support
customer_reviews.text: I ordered both right and left. One of the braces clearly got soaked at one point so poor customer service there. these are pretty comfortable and provide decent support with flexibility still. I was hoping they'd prevent any movement like the wrist guards for roller blading but if you're looking for general use and flexibility these are nice plus the sustainability approach is a nice touch. the left thumb chafes a bit and the right guard has a stich coming out but still decently built and happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Logue

customer_reviews.title: No pain now. Keep it close by to keep the pain away.
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues with early carpal tunnel symptoms due to repetitive clicks. This brace worked wonders. It helped relieve the pain I was experiencing immediately by holding the wrist in a better position. Secondly, in a bit more than I week I had no symptoms. So, I use it occasionally now if I feel a twinge at all. The only down side was that the brace seemed to be a bit tight between my thumb and forefinger, so it took a bit of time to get it on properly each time since I had to fiddle with it to get it comfortable. After that, it did just fine.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Sneed

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made!
customer_reviews.text: This brace has made my wrist pain from carpal tunnel, that has been going on for about one year, virtually disappear in three days. I wish I would have found this brace sooner. I bought a different one months ago but it doesn't work nearly as well. I don't normally write reviews, but I will recommend this to ANYONE suffering from carpal tunnel/wrist pain!!!!!!!! I feel like a new person :)
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Wisniewski

customer_reviews.title: Holds my wrist nice and straight!
customer_reviews.text: I was playing on my phone and tablet way too much and I know that's why my wrist began hurting so bad. I ordered this and began wearing it every night and my wrist improved. I think it's comfortable, if not, you have to play with adjustments, not a big deal. Easy to take off and put on also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft but solid!
customer_reviews.text: I am an artist and sometimes my wrist ends up hurting from excessive use so I will sleep with this on and it really helps. It is soft but solid so it keeps your wrist from moving too much without beating yourself up in your sleep if you toss n turn like me haha! I am considering getting another one for my left and my partner likes it too, he works at a grocery store cleaning and stocking, working the register.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Nice brace
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after I was feeling a dull pain in my wrist for a few months. I wanted to keep my wrist immobile while sleeping without interfering with my ability to sleep. This product had a lot of great reviews and didn't let me down. The lining of the brace was surprisingly soft, and you can adjust the tightness of the brace using velcro straps. Between stretching and using this brace, my wrist has been feeling better.
customer_reviews.author: spareflair

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the quality and design/comfort
customer_reviews.text: I can actually wear this when typing and using my computer mouse for work (I use an ergo mouse to keep alignment with elbow and recommend that too).. It is comfortable and better quality than others I have used. I wear it when I am sleeping with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: This really helps supports my wrist during my hours at work and is soft and comfortable to wear unlike other products I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 3 of these so far and use it every day at work. I've been having problems with my left wrist ever since I started doing upgrades to our rental property. Also, I work in a field where I have to constantly open and close bottles so that may have contributed to the injury. This really helps supports my wrist during my hours at work and is soft and comfortable to wear unlike other products I've tried commercially and given from my doctor. The material and build quality has held up since my first purchase earlier this year 2016. I purchased the thumb support as well and have been a satisfied customer. Mueller makes great products.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your wrist straight
customer_reviews.text: Was having issues with my wrist that was carpal tunnel related. feels great to not feel the pain since the guard ensures I keep it straight. It's a little annoying to have on since you have to take off to wash your hands but it's better then feeling pain.
customer_reviews.author: Krishna K

customer_reviews.title: Best quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at how good the quality of this brace is. I bought it for a sprained wrist, and I am a woman with small hands and wrists so bought the size small but was still skeptical thinking it might still be too big. It fits perfectly and is actually quite comfortable. It has memory foam over the stabilizing strip of plastic or whatever it is inside the brace. And the plastic is also molded to cup your hand so it’s not uncomfortably straight. It’s breathable too so I don’t sweat in it very much.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with this purchase and so are my wrists!
customer_reviews.text: Great for carpal tunnel. I ordered the small medium size. I measured my wrist and it was 6.5inches. If your anything over that, I would recommend the larger size as there isn’t much room left for adjustments with a 6.5 inch wrist on the S/M brace. They are much more comfortable than the store bought brace I had, I wore them while sleeping and didn’t have any discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: Though they were very comfortable, they were too big for my 5 inch wrists. There was just a small amount of velcro on the straps so I couldn't tighten them enough. Also the straps kept falling out of the slits. Which made it a pain! I've been wearing wrist braces for my carpel tunnel for 25 years and I've never had that problem before.
customer_reviews.author: DONNA RAPOSO

customer_reviews.title: Carpal tunnel from pregnancy
customer_reviews.text: I had carpal tunnel from my pregnancy. This tends to go away within the first 3 months post partum but it’s hard to handle a newborn when your wrist hurts like crazy. This was the perfect brace for my needs. Other braces I felt would have limited my ability to care for my baby in the night, but this one doesn’t really confine my fingers and knuckles. I was able to function as well as I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Mueller is the Best Brand for Braces
customer_reviews.text: My Mother and Sister both worked at a factory producing Braces for Mueller, so I’ve got first hand experience about the quality that goes into them.. I also have CarpulTunel In my right wrist.. I’ve used at least 8 different braces over the yrs.. my Mueller is the best quality given to all day use...
customer_reviews.author: TimeSpaceGuy

customer_reviews.title: BEST BRACE YET!
customer_reviews.text: I have carpal tunnel. I’ve tried several braces but this is the best one yet! It has a mega piece on the bottom part for support and the Velcro pieces work so well!! That’s the biggest complaint I have had is the Velcro always came undone on the other ones.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable- but very little support
customer_reviews.text: It's a comfortable and gives me lots of range of motion.. But that is the problem. It doesn't stop my wrist from moving it all - I've tightened it as much as possible. It says it has a metal brace but unless that is the thinnest metal known to man it is plastic because it easily bends
customer_reviews.author: cathi veretto

customer_reviews.title: Works and Worked Well
customer_reviews.text: My only concern is that I "suspect" the recycled green material may not be hypoallergenic. My skin itched and broke out while wearing these. Of course that might have also been pressure sores or due to the sweat which accumulated. I still use them because they work very well and the itching and sores stopped because I started to take them off at first sign of itchiness.
customer_reviews.author: John G Williams

product_meta.title: Mueller Green Fitted Wrist Brace, Black, Right Hand, Small/Medium
product_meta.description: Style:Right| Size:Small/MediumFitted Right Hand Wrist Brace. Possibly the most comfortable wrist brace available. Fits even the most slender wrists and hands. Breathable fabric is lightweight and comfortable for all day use Designed for carpal tunnel syndrome and support of weak or injured wrists Two adjustable straps for custom fit Two support stays with padding around spoon FSA Eligible 86271 Right Fitted Wrist Brace - SM/MD 5-8 " Right Fitted Wrist Brace - LG/XL 8-10"

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
